page.title: 07THE EXMOUTH JOURNAL
page.content: We interviewed Mr Bazell who, having worked at the Journal for 22 years, is now editor. 35 people are employed by the Journal, 10 of whom work the large printing machine which prints about 20000 papers per hour. Of the 44 Journal pages, advertisements take up on average 65%, mostly from Estate Agents. News is coming in all the time and there is never a space in the news paper. Sometimes stories from the Journal reach the National Press. Different catergories in the paper include sport, music, arts and history. There is also a children's club called the Jay club which has been running for 5 years and is organised by the editor's wife. The Journal was established in 1858 and is the biggest weekly newspaper with the largest audited circulation in East Devon. The price of this paper is 12p.
